description.en: This course is created for postgraduate students who´s thesis is based on application of Medical Biochemistry methods and tests/analyses.
description.et: Erialase teadustöö planeerimine, koostööprojektide võimaluste otsimise, eetikakomisjoni protokolli koostamise ja metoodikate omandamise õpetamine.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to provide PhD-students with instructions of planning scientific work in the field of Medical (clinical) Biochemistry, especially of planning collaboration with clinical specialities.
objectives.et: Anda doktorantidele juhiseid teadustöö planeerimiseks meditsiinilise (kliinilise) biokeemia alal, eriti teadusliku koostöö planeerimist koos kliiniliste erialadega.

learning_outcomes.en: An objective of this course is to master the knowledge about both writing of an application to Ethics Committee and planning of the concrete experimental work in the field of Medical Biochemistry regarding special demands on selected scientific aims of the thesis.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbimine annab doktorantidele juhiseid taotluste vormistamiseks TÜ Eetikakomiteele, konkreetse eksperimentaalse töö planeerimisest meditsiinilises biokeemias vastavalt spetsiaalsetele nõudmistele valitud teema teaduseesmärkide raames.

description.et: Doktorant esitab Power Pointi ettekande, mida hinnatakse positiivseks/edukaks (arvestatud) või mittearvestatud.

grade_preconditions.et: Doktorandil on valminud Power Pointi ettekanne.

grade_evaluation.et: An oral examination. Students have to analyze the principal points about planning the experimental work in the field of Medical Biochemistry regarding special demands on selected topic of the thesis.

debt_elimination.et: Kui doktorandi Power Pointi ettekanne ei osutu edukaks, antakse täpne aeg esiletoodud puuduste likvideerimiseks.

resources.recommended_materials:
1.	Principles and Techniques of Practical Biochemistry (fifth edition).  Eds. K. Wilson, J. Walker, Cambridge University Press, 2000, pp.,784.
2.	Additional special study materials (theses and scientific articles,  including articles of Department of Biochemistry and previous theses) are available for all registered students.

weeks.et: 4. n 2 L , 2S n-s;  5 - 8. n. 4 S n-s   A

description.et:
Scientific projects, their aims and used methods.
Introduction of both scientific projects and biochemical  scientific infrastructure of Department of Biochemistry.  How to plan/organize successful experimental work in the filed of Medical Biochemistry? (2 h).
The thesis-related planning experimental work (including writing of an application to Ethics Committee). Analysis of the strong points of previous different theses (18 h).
